Welcome to my Portfolio

I am Front-end Web Developer

My Work

Timber Threads

This is a brand I created over 5 years ago. This site has evolved into many different looks. I’ve also treated this site as a Font-end playground, where I can try new Front-end technologies. Last year, my very talented friend Marco, wanted to redesign the site for a portfolio piece. I jumped at the opportunity for him to give the site a long overdue face-lift. This is what we ended up with.

View:

www.timberthreads.com

Timber Hockey

This is a company that I co-founded with my partner in 2013. I handle the creative side of the company from stick designs to the overall look and feel of the site. The site is built on the Bigcommerce platform and was designed by myself. I wanted to create something unique, but simple.

View:

www.timberhockey.com

Pat Ortiz Photography

I’ve been dabbling with photography for about 3 years now. Naturally because I am front-end developer, I wanted something to display my work. So, this is a little splash page I put up to try a few new things. This is another site I get to experiment with new technologies. I felt like this was a nice look for a temporary page, while I am currently working on getting the new version up and running.

View:

www.patortiz.com

Edel Golf

This was a site I worked on for my current company TechPines. The client had a site on Shopify and was looking for a entire site makeover. After given the design, I created a responsive website using Bootstrap framework on the Shopify platform.

View:

www.edelgolf.com

About Me

Me:

Hi my name is Pat Ortiz and welcome to my portfolio site. I have been working in the Front-end field for about 5 years now and have loved ever minute of it. I was born and raised in the beautiful city of Arvada, Colorado and I am currently in Idaho Falls working for Melaleuca.

Intrests:

I LOVE the game of hockey! I also own my own clothing brand called Timber Threads. I handle anything and everything from website build out to t-shirt designs. Nothing gives me a better feeling then someone wearing my artwork. I also snap pictures from time to time under the alias Pat Ortiz. I even love being a Front-end developer; I created a site for it as well PatOrtiz.com. Feel free to shoot me a message down below!
